Title.evidence: Utilization of Optimal Medical Therapy in Chronic Limb Threatening Ischemia: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was conducted at the patient level

Participants.evidence: The trial enrolled patients diagnosed with CLTI across multiple centers. Eligibility criteria included confirmed CLTI.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the utilization of guideline-based optimal medical therapy (OMT) at the time of trial enrollment.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of patients meeting OMT criteria at baseline.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted at the patient level, with allocation concealment ensured.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1830 patients were randomised.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Adherence to OMT was modest, with only 25% meeting all four criteria, 38% meeting three, 24% meeting two, 11% meeting one, and 2% meeting none.
